item.title: You thought the banks hated bitcoin * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
You thought the banks hated bitcoin * /r/Bitcoin

Bitcoin is the currency of the Internet: a distributed, worldwide, decentralized digital money. Unlike traditional currencies such as dollars, bitcoins are issued and managed without any central authority whatsoever: there is no government, company, or bank in charge of Bitcoin. As such, it is more resistant to wild inflation and corrupt banks.

item.title: Industry Report: Bitcoin Continues Breaking Boundaries
item.description:
Industry Report: Bitcoin Continues Breaking Boundaries

In this week's Bitcoin industry report, we cover bank security, Jaxx's integration with ShapeShift, and Coinfabrik's new Coinbase API.

item.title: Observation: As Rigid Rules To Prop National Currencies Fail, Bitcoin Gains Favor
item.description:
Observation: As Rigid Rules To Prop National Currencies Fail, Bitcoin Gains Favor

Daniel Jennings, a contributor to Seeking Alpha, claims that rigid currency rules in some countries, such as China, Egypt and Zimbabwe, are pushing demand for bitcoin, boosting its price. He says national currencies may no longer be viable in some countries.

item.title: Cerber Bitcoin Ransomware Now Includes Malware Factory Automation
item.description:
Cerber Bitcoin Ransomware Now Includes Malware Factory Automation

As the summer draws ever closer, the chances of getting a computer infected with malicious software seem to increase exponentially. The latest version of Cerber ransomware is introducing new challenges for security experts. Malware factory has been introduced, which creates different versions of Cerber every 15 seconds.

item.title: Hidden Meanings of Ethereum Logo: Love, Compassion, Energy and Self-Reflection
item.description:
Hidden Meanings of Ethereum Logo: Love, Compassion, Energy and Self-Reflection

A careful look at the Coca Cola logo will reveal a hidden Danish flag. So is the arrow in FedEx which symbolizes forward moving. And the shaving stick hidden somewhere between the first two letters of Gillette. What do you see in the Ethereum logo?

item.title: Businesses Stockpile Bitcoin For Ransomware | PYMNTS.com
item.description:
Businesses Stockpile Bitcoin For Ransomware | PYMNTS.com

A U.K. corporate networking firm has found some intriguing patterns emerging among corporations as the risk of cybercrime grows. Researchers at Citrix this month found evidence that businesses are shoring up reserves of bitcoin so they can pay ransoms as quickly as possible should they be hit with ransomware.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Breaking Down Today's Action
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Breaking Down Today's Action

Here's what we are focusing on for this morning's session out of Europe in the bitcoin price. Yesterday evening, we published the second of our twice-daily bitcoin price analyses. Our primary concern in the piece, was that bitcoin had gained so much throughout the day, but that as a result, expected a pretty wide scale correction on these gains.

item.title: Hong Kong Regulator: "Blockchain Can Prevent Money Laundering"
item.description:
Hong Kong Regulator: "Blockchain Can Prevent Money Laundering"

Regulators have not always keen on blockchain technology, but lately they have started to seeing its potential benefits. A Hong Kong regulator has indicated how the blockchain can help financial institutions to overcome money laundering. Also read: Antonopoulos: 'Meteor' Bitcoin Doesn't Compete Against 'Dinosaur' Banks The essential traits of blockchain technology make it a robust solution to fight money laundering.

item.title: What date does halving happen at?
item.description:
What date does halving happen at?

When does the 2016 halving happen? Is it a predicted date for it or could be when network load is achieved?

item.title: Ethereum Hits $1.5 Million Market Cap amid Bitcoin Surge
item.description:
Ethereum Hits $1.5 Million Market Cap amid Bitcoin Surge

It is positive to see multiple cryptocurrencies faring well at the same time. Bitcoin and Ethereum are not competing with each other by any means, and they can peacefully co-exist. Amidst all of the Bitcoin craze, people would almost forget Ethereum is doing extremely well at the same time.
